'''Ciara Princess Wilson'''<ref name="Us Weekly"/> ({{IPAc-en|s|i|ˈ|ɛər|ə}} {{respell|see|AIR|ə}};<ref>{{cite book|last1=Olausson|first1=Lena|last2=Sangster|first2=Catherine|year=2006|title=Oxford BBC Guide to Pronunciation|publisher=Oxford University Press|page=73|isbn=0-19-280710-2}}</ref> {{née}} '''Harris''', born October 25, 1985) is an American singer, songwriter, and dancer. She released her debut studio album, ''[[Goodies (Ciara album)|Goodies]]'' in 2004, which spawned four singles: "[[Goodies (song)|Goodies]]" (featuring [[Petey Pablo]]), "[[1, 2 Step]]" (featuring [[Missy Elliott]]), "[[Oh (Ciara song)|Oh]]" (featuring [[Ludacris]]) and "[[And I]]". "Goodies" topped the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], as well as the [[UK Singles Chart]], while "1, 2 Step" and "Oh" both peaked at two on the Hot 100 and charted within the top five in the UK. The album was certified triple platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) and garnered two nominations at the [[48th Annual Grammy Awards]]. Ciara was also featured on [[Missy Elliott]]'s "[[Lose Control (Missy Elliott song)|Lose Control]]" and [[Bow Wow (rapper)|Bow Wow]]'s "[[Like You (Bow Wow song)|Like You]]", both of which reached number three on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. In 2006, Ciara released her second studio album, ''[[Ciara: The Evolution]]'', which spawned the hit singles "[[Get Up (Ciara song)|Get Up]]" (featuring [[Chamillionaire]]), "[[Promise (Ciara song)|Promise]]", "[[Like a Boy]]" and "[[Can't Leave 'em Alone]]" (featuring [[50 Cent]]). The album reached number one in the U.S. and was certified platinum.

Ciara's third studio album, ''[[Fantasy Ride]]'' (2009) was less successful than her first two albums. However, it produced the international top-ten single "[[Love Sex Magic]]" (featuring [[Justin Timberlake]]), which received a Grammy Award nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals|Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals]]. The following year, Ciara released her fourth studio album ''[[Basic Instinct (album)|Basic Instinct]]'', which included the [[Billboard Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs|R&B]] top-five single "[[Ride (Ciara song)|Ride]]" (featuring Ludacris). After ''Basic Instinct'' was met with low sales, Ciara signed a new record deal with [[Epic Records]] in 2011. Ciara's fifth studio album, ''[[Ciara (album)|Ciara]]'' (2013), peaked at number two on the ''Billboard'' 200. It spawned the single "[[Body Party]]", which peaked within the top-ten of the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart. Her sixth album, ''[[Jackie (Ciara album)|Jackie]]'' (2015), included the singles "[[I Bet (Ciara song)|I Bet]]" and "[[Dance like We're Making Love]]". The next year, Ciara would sign a modeling contract with [[IMG Models|IMG]],<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=http://www.hotnewhiphop.com/ciara-has-signed-a-modeling-deal-with-img-news.21596.html?|title=Ciara signs deal with IMG Models|last=Smith|first=Trevor|date=May 13, 2016|website=Hotnewhiphop|access-date=May 13, 2016}}</ref> become a Global Brand Ambassador for the [[cosmetics]] giant [[Revlon]],<ref name="auto1">{{cite web|url=http://people.com/style/ciara-is-revlons-new-ambassador-reveals-my-name-came-from-one-of-their-fragrances/|title=Ciara Is Revlon's New Ambassador, Reveals 'My Name Came From One of Their Fragrances'|last=Fields|first=Jackie|date=October 18, 2016|magazine=People|access-date=June 15, 2017}}</ref> and marry quarterback [[Russell Wilson]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Melas|first=Chloe|date=6 July 2016|title=It's official: Ciara and Russell Wilson get married|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2016/07/06/entertainment/ciara-russell-wilson-married/index.html|url-status=live|access-date=7 May 2021|website=[[CNN]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160706225655/http://edition.cnn.com/2016/07/06/entertainment/ciara-russell-wilson-married/index.html |archive-date=July 6, 2016 }}</ref> Her seventh album, ''[[Beauty Marks (album)|Beauty Marks]]'' (2019), included the hit single "[[Level Up (Ciara song)|Level Up]]". Ciara would return in 2022 having signed a new record deal with [[Republic Records]] and [[Uptown Records]], in partnership with her label, Beauty Marks Entertainment. She released her single "[[Jump (Ciara song)|Jump]]" as the lead for her upcoming eighth studio album on July 8, 2022.<ref>{{cite web|author=Jason Lipshutz |url=https://www.billboard.com/business/record-labels/ciara-republic-records-uptown-records-label-deal-new-single-jump-1235108466/ |title=Ciara Signs Label Deal With Republic, Uptown Records: Exclusive – Billboard |publisher=Billboard.com |date=2022-06-29 |accessdate=2022-06-30}}</ref> 

Ciara is also an actress, having appeared in ''[[All You've Got]]'' (2006), ''[[Mama, I Want to Sing! (film)|Mama, I Want to Sing!]]'' (2012), ''[[That's My Boy (2012 film)|That’s My Boy]]'' (2012), and 
''[[The Game (U.S. TV series)|The Game]]'' (2013). In March 2022, it was announced that Ciara had joined the cast of the 2023 [[The Color Purple (2023 film)|remake]] of ''[[The Color Purple (1985 film)|The Color Purple]]'' as Nettie.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://ratedrnb.com/2022/09/ciara-and-summer-walker-move-on-to-better-thangs-on-new-song|title=Ciara & Summer Walker Move on to "Better Thangs" on New Song|website=Rated R&B|last=Folk|first=Antwane|date=September 28, 2022|access-date=October 3, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.backstage.com/magazine/article/greenlt-ciara-joins-the-color-purple-74925/|title='The Color Purple' Adds Ciara to Its All-Star Cast|website=Backstage|last=Steves|first=Ashley|date=March 31, 2022|access-date=October 3, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.vulture.com/2022/04/the-color-purple-movie-musical-cast-release-date.html|title=Grammy Winner Jon Batiste Makes Acting Debut in Color Purple Film|website=Vulture|last=Curto|first=Justin|date=April 15, 2022|access-date=October 3, 2022}}</ref>

Ciara has received [[List of awards and nominations received by Ciara|multiple accolades]], including a [[Grammy Awards|Grammy Award]], two [[BET Awards]], two [[MTV Video Music Awards]], seven [[Soul Train Music Awards|Soul Train Awards]], thirteen [[American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers|Ascap Music Awards]]. As of 2019, Ciara's worldwide sales total over 45 million.<ref>{{cite press release |url=https://www.theamas.com/2019/11/just-announced-ciara-to-host-kesha-to-perform-at-amas/ |title=Just Announced: Ciara to Host & Kesha to Perform at AMAs |publisher=American Music Awards |date=November 14, 2019 |access-date=March 21, 2022}}</ref>

==Early life==
Ciara Princess Harris was born in [[Fort Hood, Texas]],<ref>{{Cite news|last=Baron|first=Zach|title=Russell Wilson & Ciara: The Superstar Couple In Pursuit of Perfection|url=https://www.gq.com/story/russell-wilson-ciara-march-modern-lovers-cover|access-date=February 11, 2021|website=GQ|date=February 11, 2021|language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last= |first= |date= |title=Ciara {{!}} Biography & History |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7dnI3btuvlM |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210211200004/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7dnI3btuvlM&gl=US&hl=en |archive-date=February 11, 2021 |access-date=February 12, 2021 |website=AllMusic}}</ref> on October 25, 1985,<ref name="allmusic">{{cite web |last=Jeffries |first=David |title=Ciara Biography |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/ciara-mn0000215513/biography |access-date=April 30, 2017 |publisher=[[AllMusic.com]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Ogunnaike |first=Lola |date=December 6, 2006 |title=One Name, Many Goals for a Driven R&B Star |newspaper=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/12/06/arts/music/06ciar.html?_r=1&oref=slogin |access-date=November 18, 2008}}</ref> the only child of Jackie and Carlton Clay Harris.<ref name=biography.com>{{cite web|url=http://www.biography.com/people/ciara-21330599|title=Ciara: Singer (1985–)|publisher=[[Biography.com]] ([[FYI (TV network)|FYI]] / [[A&E Networks]])|access-date=April 30, 2017}}</ref> An [[army brat]], she grew up in Georgia, New York, [[Utah]], [[California]], [[Arizona]], and [[Nevada]].<ref name="Billboard 1">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/299324/ciara/biography|title=Ciara – Biography|magazine=Billboard|access-date=November 14, 2015}}</ref> She was named after the [[Revlon]] fragrance Ciara which was introduced in 1973.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://people.com/style/ciara-is-revlons-new-ambassador-reveals-my-name-came-from-one-of-their-fragrances/|title=Ciara Is Revlon's New Ambassador, Reveals 'My Name Came From One of Their Fragrances'|date=October 18, 2016|website=People|access-date=July 11, 2017}}</ref> During her teens, Ciara and her family settled in [[Atlanta]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]].<ref name="Billboard 1" />

In her mid-teens, Ciara formed the all-girl group Hearsay with two of her friends.{{who|date=January 2016}} The group recorded demos, but as time went on, they began to have differences and eventually parted ways.<ref name="Billboard 1" /> Despite this setback, Ciara signed a publishing deal as a songwriter.{{Citation needed|date=March 2022}}

Her first writing credit was on [[Blu Cantrell]]'s debut album, ''[[So Blu]]'', for the song "10,000 Times". She also wrote the song "Got Me Waiting" for [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] singer [[Fantasia Barrino]]'s debut album, ''[[Free Yourself]]''.<ref name="Billboard 1" /> It was when she was writing songs that she met music producer [[Jazze Pha]], whom she called her "music soulmate". In 2002, the two recorded four demos: "[[1, 2 Step]]", "Thug Style", "Pick Up the Phone", and "Lookin' at You", which all appeared on her debut album that was released two years later. "1, 2 Step" was the second single released from the album and it was a hit.<ref name="Billboard 1" />

==Career==

===2003–2005: ''Goodies''===
After graduating from [[Riverdale High School (Riverdale, Georgia)|Riverdale High School]] in [[Riverdale, Georgia]] in 2003, she was signed by [[LaFace Records]] [[record executive|executive]], [[L.A. Reid]], whom she was introduced to by Jazze Pha.<ref name="hitquarters.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.hitquarters.com/index.php3?page=intrview/opar/intrview_MarkPitts.html|title=Interview with Mark Pitts|publisher=[[HitQuarters]]|date=April 24, 2006|access-date=December 10, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121024082039/http://www.hitquarters.com/index.php3?page=intrview/opar/intrview_MarkPitts.html|archive-date=October 24, 2012|url-status=dead}}</ref> She began production on her debut album later that year. In early 2004, she wrote a demo with record producer, [[Sean Garrett]], which came to the attention of [[Lil Jon]] and became her debut single "[[Goodies (song)|Goodies]]". Lil Jon stated later that he knew it would be big seeing how it sounded similar to [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]]'s international hit, "[[Yeah! (Usher song)|Yeah!]]".<ref name="Billboard 1" />

Ciara released her debut album ''[[Goodies (Ciara album)|Goodies]]'' on September 28, 2004. The album debuted at number three on the U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], selling 125,000 copies in its initial week<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1492000/20041006/duff_hilary.jhtml|title=Hilary Duff Debuts at No. 2, Ciara Lands at No. 3 On Albums Chart|first=James|last=Montgomery|work=[[MTV News]]|publisher=MTV Networks ([[Viacom (2005–present)|Viacom]])|date=October 6, 2009|access-date=July 21, 2010}}</ref> and topped the [[Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums]] chart. Following the release of the album, Ciara was called the "First Lady of [[Crunk&B]]". ''Goodies'' had a 71-week run on the ''Billboard'' 200, and was [[RIAA certification|certified]] triple platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] on October 10, 2006.<ref name="RIAA">[https://archive.today/20120913013050/http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpage=1&table=SEARCH_RESULTS&action=&title=&artist=Ciara&format=&debutLP=&category=&sex=&releaseDate=&requestNo=&type=&level=&label=&company=&certificationDate=&awardDescription=&catalogNo=&aSex=&rec_id=&charField=&gold=&platinum=&multiPlat=&level2=&certDate=&album=&id=&after=&before=&startMonth=1&endMonth=1&startYear=1958&endYear=2008&sort=Artist&perPage=25 RIAA Searchable Database – "Ciara"]. Recording Industry Association of America. Accessed May 21, 2008.</ref> Charting at twenty-two on the [[Canadian Albums Chart]], it was certified Platinum by the [[Canadian Recording Industry Association]].<ref name="criat">{{cite web|title=Database Search|work=[[Canadian Recording Industry Association]]|url=http://www.cria.ca/cert_db_search.php|access-date=July 29, 2007|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100501065534/http://www.cria.ca/cert_db_search.php|archive-date=May 1, 2010}}</ref> The album charted at 26 on the [[UK Albums Chart]], and spent 20 weeks on the chart.<ref name="uk">{{cite web|url=http://www.bpi.co.uk/certifiedawards/search.aspx|title=Certified Awards|work=[[British Phonographic Industry]]|access-date=July 20, 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090924015932/http://www.bpi.co.uk/certifiedawards/search.aspx|archive-date=September 24, 2009}}</ref> It was certified Gold by the [[British Phonographic Industry]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bpi.co.uk/brit-certified/|website=[[British Phonographic Industry]]|access-date=May 25, 2022|title=BPI Goodies Certification}}</ref>

''Goodies''{{'}} [[lead single]], [[Goodies (song)|the title track]], featuring [[Petey Pablo]], was released on June 8, 2004. Conceived as a [[crunk]] female counterpart to [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]]'s "[[Yeah! (Usher song)|Yeah!]]", the lyrical content goes against the grain, speaking of [[abstinence]], rejecting advances because "the goodies will stay in the jar." Critics hailed it as an "anthem of the summer" and one of the best singles of the year, complementing its dance-feel and beat, and the irony of the "clever" lyrics. The single performed well worldwide, topping the charts in Canada, the United States and the United Kingdom, and charting in the top 10 of other charts, receiving Platinum certification in the United States.<ref name="Discography">{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/en/showinterpret.asp?interpret=Ciara|title=Discography Ciara|work=Ultratop.be|publisher=Hung Medien|access-date=July 22, 2007}}</ref><ref name="Charthistory">{{cite magazine|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=ciara|chart=all}}|title=Ciara Album & Chart History|magazine=Billboard|access-date=December 16, 2010}}</ref> "1, 2 Step" featuring [[Missy Elliott]] was released as the album's second single.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gfa.radioandrecords.com/publishGFA/GFANextPage.asp?sDate=11/02/2004&Format=9|title=R&R :: Going For Adds :: Rhythmic|access-date=July 22, 2010|work=Radio & Records|publisher=Radio & Records|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130526021237/http://gfa.radioandrecords.com/publishGFA/GFANextPage.asp?sDate=11%2F02%2F2004&Format=9|archive-date=May 26, 2013}}</ref> The song peaked in the top 10 of many countries, topping the charts in Canada, and went on to become Platinum or Gold in many countries.<ref name="Discography" /><ref name="Charthistory" /> "[[Oh (Ciara song)|Oh]]" featuring [[Ludacris]] was released as the third single on March 5, 2005. The song performed well worldwide, appearing in the top 10 of seven charts, and certified either Platinum or Gold in multiple regions.<ref name="Discography" /><ref name="Charthistory" />

Following the success of the album, Ciara released a CD/DVD entitled ''[[Goodies: The Videos & More]]'' in the United States on July 12, 2005, which featured remixes to "1, 2 Step" and "Oh", as well as two new songs. The release was certified platinum in the United States. She made guest appearances on [[Missy Elliott]]'s single "[[Lose Control (Missy Elliott song)|Lose Control]]" and on [[Bow Wow (rapper)|Bow Wow]]'s single "[[Like You (Bow Wow song)|Like You]]", which both peaked at number three in the United States and obtained worldwide success. She was an opening act for [[Gwen Stefani]]'s ''[[Harajuku Lovers Tour 2005]]'' and went on tour with [[Chris Brown (American singer)|Chris Brown]] and [[Bow Wow (rapper)|Bow Wow]] on the ''Holiday Jam Tour'' in December 2005. At the [[48th Annual Grammy Awards]], Ciara received four nominations for [[Grammy Award for Best New Artist|Best New Artist]], [[Grammy Award for Best Rap/Sung Collaboration|Best Rap/Sung Collaboration]] for "1, 2 Step", [[Grammy Award for Best Rap Song|Best Rap Song]] for Missy Elliott's single "Lose Control", and won her last nomination, [[Grammy Award for Best Short Form Music Video|Best Short Form Music Video]] for "Lose Control".<ref name="Grammy">{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/music/awards/grammys/2005-12-08-grammy-list-nominations_x.htm|title=Complete list of Grammy Award nominations|work=[[USA Today]]|date=August 8, 2005|access-date=July 21, 2010}}</ref>

===2006–2007: ''Ciara: The Evolution'' and acting debut===
On December 5, 2006, Ciara released her second studio album, ''[[Ciara: The Evolution]]''. According to the singer, the title of the album is "about so much more than just my personal growth – it's about the evolution of music, the evolution of dance, the evolution of fashion."<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Hope|first=Clover|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/57003/ciara-previewing-evolution-on-tour|title=Ciara Previewing 'Evolution' On Tour|magazine=Billboard|date=October 10, 2006|access-date=December 13, 2006}}</ref> The source of the album's creativity such as the sound and edge comes from Ciara in general.<ref>{{cite web|last=Jones|first=Bomani|url=http://www.vibe.com/news/news_headlines/2006/09/ciara_continues_her_evolution_with_new_album/|title="Ciara Continues Her "Evolution" with New Album"|work=[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]|date=September 19, 2006|access-date=December 13, 2006|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061017021524/http://www.vibe.com/news/news_headlines/2006/09/ciara_continues_her_evolution_with_new_album/|archive-date=October 17, 2006}}</ref> ''Ciara: The Evolution'' became Ciara's first and only number one album on the U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], and her second number one on the [[Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums]] charts with sales of 338,000 in the first week. The album went on to be certified [[Platinum album|platinum]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]] in the United States, and has sold 1.3 million copies according to Nielsen SoundScan.<ref name="Chartbeat">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/957692/ask-billboard-jewel-ciara-ricky-martin|title=Ask Billboard: Jewel, Ciara, Ricky Martin|first=Gary|last=Trust|magazine=Billboard|date=June 18, 2010|access-date=July 27, 2010}}</ref>

[[File:Ciara Live 2.jpg|thumb|250px|left|Ciara performing during her debut tour [[Ciara: Live in Concert]] in November 2006]]
The album's international [[lead single]], "[[Get Up (Ciara song)|Get Up]]", which features [[Chamillionaire]], reached number seven in the United States and gained a platinum accreditation. It reached number five in New Zealand.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://charts.nz/showitem.asp?interpret=Ciara+feat.+Chamillionaire&titel=Get+Up&cat=s|title=Ciara feat. Chamillionaire – Get Up|publisher=charts.nz|access-date=December 17, 2010}}</ref> The song was used for the film ''[[Step Up (film)|Step Up]]'' (2006) and featured on the film's [[Step Up (Original Soundtrack)|soundtrack]]. The album's US lead single, "[[Promise (Ciara song)|Promise]]", reached number 11 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and became her third number one single on the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart. "[[Like a Boy]]" was released as the second international single which reached within the top 20 in the UK,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.everyhit.com/searchsec.php|title=everyHit.com search results|publisher=everyHIT.com|access-date=December 16, 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081012195559/http://www.everyhit.com/searchsec.php|archive-date=October 12, 2008}}</ref> Finland,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://finnishcharts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=Ciara&titel=Like+A+Boy&cat=s|title=Ciara – Like a Boy|publisher=finnishcharts.com. Hung Medien|access-date=December 17, 2010}}</ref> France, Ireland, Sweden<ref>{{cite web|url=http://swedishcharts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=Ciara&titel=Like+A+Boy&cat=s|title=Ciara – Like a Boy|publisher=swedishcharts.com. Hung Medien|access-date=December 17, 2010}}</ref> Switzerland, and also in the United States.<ref name="billboard chart history">[{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=ciara|chart=all}} Ciara – Billboard Artist Chart History]{{dead link|date=July 2011}} ''[[Billboard Charts]]''; retrieved December 17, 2010.</ref> The fourth and final single from the album, "[[Can't Leave 'em Alone]]", reached number 10 on the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart and number 40 on the ''Billboard Hot 100.''<ref>{{cite web|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=ciara|chart=all}}|title=Can't Leave 'Em Alove – 50 Cent|access-date=July 16, 2012}}</ref> The song became Ciara's fifth single to peak in the top in New Zealand, peaking at number 4.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://charts.nz/showitem.asp?interpret=Ciara+feat%2E+50+Cent&titel=Can%27t+Leave+%27Em+Alone&cat=s|title=Ciara feat. 50 Cent – Can't Leave 'Em Alone|publisher=charts.nz|access-date=July 16, 2012}}</ref> The song achieved moderate success in other international markets.

In support of the album, Ciara went on [[Ciara: Live in Concert|her first headlining tour]] in October 2006. The tour went to seventeen different clubs in cities throughout the United States. The tour was met with mixed to positive reviews; critics were divided regarding the pre-recorded backing tracks and remarked that Ciara was slightly under-prepared to host her headlining tour, but ultimately praised her energetic choreography. In August 2007, she headlined the [[Screamfest '07]] tour with fellow rapper, [[T.I.]] Critics praised her performance for her gracious dancing and being able to command a sold-out arena.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://backtorockville.typepad.com/back_to_rockville/2007/08/review-screamfe.html|title=Review: Screamfest '07|access-date=July 16, 2012}}</ref> Ciara, along with [[Chris Brown (American singer)|Chris Brown]] and [[Akon]], was a support act for [[Rihanna]]'s ''[[Good Girl Gone Bad Tour]]'' in the United Kingdom. She made a guest appearance on "[[So What (Field Mob song)|So What]]" by [[Field Mob]]. The single went on to become a top 10 hit on the ''Billboard Hot 100.'' She also appeared on [[Tiffany Evans]]' single "[[Promise Ring (song)|Promise Ring]]". The song achieved little success on the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart.

In addition to her music, Ciara made her acting debut in the [[MTV Films]] production ''[[All You've Got]]'' in May 2006. In the movie she played Becca Whiley, a teenager who is competing in a volleyball tournament. The movie received mixed to positive reviews; critics said the movie was predictable but still enjoyable.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0458465/externalreviews|title=All You've Got (2006) – External reviews|website=[[IMDb]]|access-date=July 16, 2012}}</ref>

===2008–2011: ''Fantasy Ride'', ''Basic Instinct'' and label change===
[[File: Ciara 2009.jpg|thumb|Ciara at the Maxim Magazine's 10th Annual Hot 100 Celebration in 2009]]
In October 2008, Ciara was honored as ''Billboard''{{'}}s "Woman of the Year", because of her success as a recording artist and leadership in embracing the changing music business.<ref>{{cite web|last=Joszor|first=Njai|url=http://www.singersroom.com/news/2498/Billboard-Names-Ciara-Woman-Of-The-Year|title=Billboard Names Ciara "Woman Of The Year"|work=Singers Room|date=October 15, 2008|access-date=December 17, 2010}}</ref>
Although her third album was originally scheduled for a September 2008 release, ''[[Fantasy Ride]]'' was released after several delays in May 2009. The album combines her [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] and [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] sound from her previous albums along with a new [[Pop music|pop]] and [[Dance music|dance]] sound. While talking to MTV News, Ciara said, "I'm having a bit more fun with my lyrics. I'm not afraid. In the beginning, I was conscious and really protective and somewhat scared about doing some things. With this album I'm not holding back, there's freedom. It's just the space I'm in right now."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1610701/ciara-talks-fantasy-ride-im-not-holding-back.jhtml|title=Ciara Talks Fantasy Ride: 'I'm Not Holding Back'|website=[[MTV]]|access-date=July 16, 2012}}</ref> It became Ciara's first top ten album in the UK.

"[[Go Girl (Ciara song)|Go Girl]]" was the first single released from the album. It was originally the lead single from the album, but the single achieved minimum success and was later deemed a [[promo single]]. However, the single managed to reach the top of the charts in Japan. The album's official [[lead single]], "[[Never Ever (Ciara song)|Never Ever]]", which features [[Young Jeezy]], was released in the United States in January 2009 and reached a peak of number nine on the U.S. [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]]. The second single, "[[Love Sex Magic]]", featuring [[Justin Timberlake]], became a worldwide hit, peaking within the top 10 in 20 countries including the U.S., where it peaked at number 10 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. It went on to be certified platinum in Australia<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accr.htm|title=ARIA Charts – Accreditations – 2009 Singles|publisher=Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA)|access-date=December 17, 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120212185140/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accr.htm|archive-date=February 12, 2012}}</ref> and received a gold accreditation in New Zealand.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radioscope.net.nz/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=77&Itemid=63|title=Gold / Platinum Singles|publisher=RadioScope|access-date=August 16, 2009|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724195729/http://www.radioscope.net.nz/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=77&Itemid=63|archive-date=July 24, 2011}}</ref> It received a nomination for "Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals" at the [[52nd Annual Grammy Awards]] and also for Best Choreography in a Video at the [[2009 MTV Video Music Awards]]. "[[Work (Ciara song)|Work]]", the final single, achieved moderate success in international markets.

In July 2009, Ciara headlined the ''[[Jay-Z & Ciara Live]]'' tour with [[Jay-Z]]. Her performance received mixed reviews; critics said although her dancing was top-notch, she seemed disconnected from the crowd.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/music_blog/2009/07/live-review-jayz-keeps-his-friends-close-in-las-vegas.html|title=Live review: Jay-Z keeps his friends close in Las Vegas|access-date=July 16, 2012|work=Los Angeles Times|date=July 4, 2009}}</ref> She was also the support act for [[Britney Spears]]'s ''[[The Circus Starring Britney Spears|Circus]]'' tour, where she performed eight nights at London's prestigious O2 Arena during June 2009.<ref>{{cite web|last=Lewis|first=Pete|url=http://www.bluesandsoul.com/feature/410/minx_to_the_max/|title=CIARA: STAR BRIGHT|year=2009|work=[[Blues & Soul]]|access-date=October 27, 2010}}</ref> Her performance received rave reviews from critics and fans alike, who noted her dancing skills as being spectacular and arguably better than Britney Spears'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gossiponthis.com/2009/06/04/ciara-britney-spears-perform-for-the-circus-starring-britney-spears-tour-at-the-o2-arena-in-london/|title=Ciara & Britney Spears Perform for "The Circus: Starring Britney Spears Tour" at the O2 Arena in London|date=June 5, 2009|access-date=July 16, 2012}}</ref> Ciara made a guest appearance on [[Nelly]]'s single "[[Stepped On My J'z]]" from his album ''[[Brass Knuckles (album)|Brass Knuckles]]''. Ciara was also featured on [[Enrique Iglesias]]' single, "[[Takin' Back My Love]]", from his ''[[Greatest Hits (Enrique Iglesias album)|Greatest Hits]]'' album. The song became an international hit, peaking in the top 10 of over 15 countries, and being certified Gold in Russia, with sales of over 100,000. In February 2010, Ciara along with [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]] was featured on the remix to [[Ludacris]]' hit single "[[How Low]]". The following month, Ciara made a cameo appearance in the music video of [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]]'s single, "[[Lil' Freak]]".

When it comes to artists, when it comes to writers, when it comes to producers, I really wanted to push. We pretty much reached out and worked with a lot of people that I've never worked with before, which is really fun."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2012/06/04/ciara-shares-producers-on-one-woman-army/#more-126117|title=Ciara Shares Producers on 'One Woman Army'|publisher=Rap-Up.com|access-date=February 13, 2013}}</ref>

During a press conference with [[MTV]] in May 2012, Ciara announced her fifth studio album would be titled ''[[Jackie (Ciara album)|One Woman Army]]'' and said the lead single, "[[Sweat (Ciara song)|Sweat]]", would be out very soon.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/news/a384612/ciara-confirms-new-single-sweat-album-one-woman-army.html|title=Ciara confirms new single 'Sweat', album 'One Woman Army'|last=Corner|first=Lewis|website=Digital Spy|access-date=May 31, 2012|date=May 31, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.19932/title.ciara-announces-title-of-new-album-single|title=Ciara announces the title of her upcoming fifth solo album|last=Horowitz|first=Stephen J.|magazine=HipHopDX.com|access-date=May 31, 2012|date=May 31, 2012}}</ref> The single, which features rapper [[2 Chainz]], premiered online on June 4, 2012, and was to be released via [[iTunes Store|iTunes]] on June 19, 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2012/06/04/new-music-ciara-f-2-chainz-sweat|title=New Music: Ciara f/2 Chainz – 'Sweat'|work=Rap-Up|date=June 4, 2012|access-date=June 5, 2012}}</ref> However, the release of the single was scrapped at the last minute for unknown reasons. On August 13, 2012, Ciara revealed that the official lead single for the album would be titled "[[Sorry (Ciara song)|Sorry]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/news/a399284/ciara-teases-new-single-sorry-lyrics.html|title=Ciara teases new single 'Sorry' lyrics|website=[[Digital Spy]]|date=August 14, 2012|access-date=August 14, 2012}}</ref> On September 13, 2012, the official music video for "Sorry" was premiered on [[Black Entertainment Television|BET]]'s [[106 & Park]] as well as [[VEVO]]. On October 21, 2012, ''[[Rap-Up]]'' magazine posted a behind-the-scenes sneak peek of "[[Got Me Good (Ciara song)|Got Me Good]]", the second single from the album. The single was released via [[Music download|digital download]] on November 6, 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2012/10/24/ciara-to-perform-on-kimmel-premiere-got-me-good-video-in-times-square/#more-140395|title=Ciara to Perform on 'Kimmel', Premiere 'Got Me Good' Video in Times Square|publisher=Rap-Up.com|date=October 24, 2012|access-date=February 13, 2013}}</ref> "[[Got Me Good (Ciara song)|Got Me Good]]" impacted rhythmic radio on November 13,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.allaccess.com/top40-rhythmic/future-releases |title=Future Releases |access-date=October 31, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121111180956/http://www.allaccess.com/top40-rhythmic/future-releases |archive-date=November 11, 2012 |url-status=dead  }}</ref> and [[Contemporary hit radio|mainstream]] radio on December 4.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.allaccess.com/top40-mainstream/future-releases |title=Top 40/M Future Releases | Mainstream Hit Songs Being Released and Their Release Dates |access-date=October 31, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121111183609/http://www.allaccess.com/top40-mainstream/future-releases |archive-date=November 11, 2012 |url-status=live  }}{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131106063858/http://www.allaccess.com/top40-mainstream/future-releases |date=November 6, 2013 }}</ref>

At the time of ''Fantasy Ride's'' (2009) release, Ciara introduced her alter ego "Super C". Ciara said that Super C is her "inner strength and aggressive persona" – a futuristic, superhero-esque woman, loosely based on the robotic character Ciara portrayed in the "[[Go Girl (Ciara song)|Go Girl]]" music video. Ciara described her reasoning for developing an alter ego, "There's so much negative energy in the world, especially within the blogging world, they try so hard to tear you down. ==Other ventures==
===Business===
Ciara became the face of [[Jay-Z]]'s [[Rocawear]] clothing line and spokesperson for the women campaign titled "I Will Not Lose", which debuted in the summer of 2007. In the October issue of ''[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe Magazine]]'', she appeared, apparently nude, on the magazine cover but claimed ''Vibe'' had airbrushed her clothes off. She told ''[[MTV News]]'' that she was hurt by the photos and was quite shocked when she finally got her hands on the month's issue. She later confirmed that she was in fact clothed.<ref>{{cite web|last=Harris|first=Chris|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1595459/20080923/ciara.jhtml|title=Ciara Insists: I Wasn't Nude In Vibe Magazine|date=September 23, 2009|work=[[MTV News]]|access-date=September 23, 2008}}</ref>

In 2009, Ciara signed a multimillion-dollar deal with the modeling agency [[Wilhelmina Models]]. After signing the deal she has been in many magazine spreads. In addition to that, she also has her eyes set on beginning a new clothing line. In June 2008, she was in talks with the department store [[Steve & Barry's]] to create an affordable clothing line,<ref>[http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/content_display/industry/e3iac49c752f1f09871b0c1475f352ba584 Billboard Biz: Ciara Inks With Modeling Agency, Eyes Clothing Line] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100105172816/http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/content_display/industry/e3iac49c752f1f09871b0c1475f352ba584 |date=January 5, 2010 }} ''Billboard''. Retrieved October 27, 2008.</ref> but it never happened. On November 9, 2009, it was announced that Ciara would be modeling in the German edition of ''Vogue''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/category/artist/ciara|title=Ciara|work=[[Rap-Up]]|access-date=October 27, 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101029201923/http://www.rap-up.com/category/artist/ciara/|archive-date=October 29, 2010}}</ref> During that time, it was also announced that Ciara would be the new face of a major multimedia ad campaign for Verizon's smartphone the LG Chocolate Touch. Ciara filmed a commercial for the campaign, which features her dancing to her 2009 single, "[[Work (Ciara song)|Work]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2009/11/09/ciara-shoots-for-vogue-signs-on-as-lg-spokeswoman|title=Ciara Shoots for 'Vogue,' Signs on as LG Spokeswoman|work=[[Rap-Up]]|date=November 9, 2009|access-date=July 23, 2013}}</ref> In March 2010, it was officially confirmed and announced that Ciara was the spokesperson in the new ad campaign for Adidas Originals. A commercial for the campaign was released the same month, featuring numerous other celebrities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2010/03/17/video-ciara-snoop-dogg-adrienne-bailon-star-in-adidas-commercials|title=Video: Ciara, Snoop Dogg and Adrienne Bailon star in Adidas Commercials|work=[[Rap-Up]]|access-date=October 27, 2010}}</ref>

On May 12, 2016, it was announced that Ciara signed a modeling contract with [[IMG Models|IMG]].<ref name="auto"/>  Later that year, she became a Global Brand Ambassador for the [[cosmetics]] giant [[Revlon]].<ref name="auto1"/>

In August 2019, she and her husband Russell Wilson became part of the ownership group of [[Seattle Sounders FC]] in [[Major League Soccer]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Evans |first=Jayda |date=August 13, 2019 |title=Russell Wilson, Ciara, Macklemore, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and more join Sounders ownership |url=https://www.seattletimes.com/sports/sounders/russell-wilson-ciara-macklemore-microsoft-execs-and-more-join-sounders-ownership-group/ |work=The Seattle Times |access-date=August 13, 2019}}</ref>

In 2020, along with her husband and entrepreneur and mentor Christine Day, she founded the fashion house The House of LR&C, combining the Good Man Brand, LITA by Ciara and Human Nation collections.<ref name=":0" /> In 2021, Ciara releases the Dare To Roam collection of recycled plastic backpacks and bags.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hyde|first=Shelby Ying|date=2021-08-11|title=Ciara's New Accessories Line is All About a Chic Backpack|url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/fashion/trends/a37279250/ciara-backpacks-dare-to-roam/|access-date=2021-08-31|website=Harper's BAZAAR|language=en-US}}</ref>

Ciara, along with her husband, owns the television entertainment, advertising, and film production company Why Not You Productions, which has been affiliated with [[Amazon Prime Video]] since 2021.<ref>{{cite web|last=Del Rosario|first=Alexandra|date=2021-05-11|title=Russell Wilson & Ciara Strike First-Look Deal With Amazon Studios Through Why Not You Banner|url=https://deadline.com/2021/05/russell-wilson-ciara-strike-first-look-deal-amazon-studios-why-not-you-banner-1234753994/|access-date=2021-08-31|website=Deadline|language=en-US}}</ref>
